title: Covid-19: What are the lessons learned from three years of global health emergency?
description: The WHO anounced the end of the maximum alert level for the pandemic on Friday, but the UN organization added that the virus is not eradicated.

title: In pictures: Naples erupts in joy after first Napoli Series A win in 33 years
description: After thirty-three years of waiting, SCC Napoli Naples won the Italian football championship, its first title since the two titles won with Diego Maradona in 1987 and 1990. Thousands of fans celebrated the victory of their team in the city's streets.

title: India's Modi to join Macron for France's Bastille Day
description: Like the US, France sees developments in the Indo-Pacific as crucial to the future geopolitical balance of power and is stepping up engagement in the region.

title: UK Tories suffer losses in PM Sunak's first electoral test
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak admitted results looked 'disappointing.'

title: US Supreme Court faces conflict of interest accusations
description: New revelations shed light on the financial details of Justice Clarence Thomas' relationship with conservative Texas billionaire Harlan Crow.

title: Who is Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury who will crown Charles III?
description: In the United Kingdom, the Anglican Church official in charge of the coronation of the King and the Queen Consort on May 6 has an atypical background. He previously had a fairly long career in the oil industry.

title: In France, restitution of African artifacts is subject to conditions
description: A report issued by Jean-Luc Martinez, the former president of the Louvre, recommends nine criteria for the restitution of goods looted from Africa.

title: Covid-19: WHO downgrades pandemic, says it's no longer a global health emergency
description: The head of the World Health Organization said on Friday that the 'pandemic is over, but Covid is not.'

title: France convicted for detention of foreign children as young as 7 months old
description: These new decisions bring the number of European Court of Human Rights rulings against France in this area to 11, according to French NGO La Cimade.

title: 'Showing Up' review: Kelly Reichardt depicts the life of an artist at work
description: The American director's latest film, starring Michelle Williams, is like a long prayer devoted to the work of a sculptor preparing for her exhibition.

title: Joe Biden reminds AI industry bosses of their 'duty' to confront the dangers of their software
description: The White House advocates a more flexible and less restrictive approach to corporate responsibility.

title: Serbian President vows to tackle gun control after shootings
description: Weapon circulation has proliferated in the balkan country without any real control since the wars in the former Yugoslavia.

title: Zelensky calls for a 'Nuremberg' to judge the Russian leaders
description: The Ukrainian president chose the Hague, capital of international justice, to propose the creation of a tribunal for the crime of aggression.

title: Darmanin accuses Meloni of being 'unable to solve migration problems,' reviving French-Italian tensions
description: Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani canceled a planned Paris trip after France's interior minister comments.

title: Coronation of King Charles III leaves the British underwhelmed
description: While Queen Elizabeth II enjoyed enormous popularity due to her incredible longevity, 74-year-old Charles III inspires much less deference.

title: Sub-Saharan Africa suffers from overpriced internet
description: Sub-Saharan Africans pay some of the highest rates in the world for mobile internet, an issue that impacts employment and poverty reduction.

title: Shein, fast fashion's infernal machine
description: The Chinese clothing site is opening a pop-up store in Paris from May 5 to 8. The company's reach worries both its competitors and advocates of responsible fashion.

title: Wagner chief threatens to pull fighters from Bakhmut over ammo shortage
description: Wagner fighters have taken a leading role in Russia's campaign in Ukraine, spearheading the months-long fight to capture the eastern Ukrainian city.

title: European Central Bank not done with interest rate hikes
description: The ECB slowed the rate of increase from 3% to 3.25% on Thursday. But the head of the monetary institution, Christine Lagarde, warned that there is 'still a bit of a way to go.'

title: King Charles III: Who's coming to the coronation?
description: World leaders, royals and community heroes will attend the ceremony on Saturday, which is expected to be much shorter than the one staged for Elizabeth in 1953.

title: 'The British monarchy: A moth-eaten, mediatized tapestry'
description: Since the death of Queen Elizabeth, the monarchy's popularity has continued to fall, especially among young people. It will eventually be forced to reform itself, predicts British writer Will Self.

title: Environmental activists increasingly tempted to act by sabotage
description: Faced with the loss of momentum with petitions and marches for the climate, some environmentalists are choosing to destroy or deface material goods in the name of the climate emergency.

title: 'One question should be playing on Westerners' minds: why isn't the Global South protesting more against the imperialist adventures of Putin's Russia?'
description: Global South countries – particularly in Africa – believe the West to be the main culprit behind Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the fuel and food price inflation plaguing them, writes columnist Alain Frachon.

title: In Canada, Francophones claim Jack Kerouac as one of their own
description: French Canadians say it is time to give Kerouac his full identity back: that of a writer torn between two geographies, and whose linguistic insecurity informed his work.

title: Adila Bendimerad: 'In movies, Algeria is still viewed mainly in the context of colonization and the years of terrorism'
description: The Algerian actress and director talks about her latest film "The Last Queen" and its portrayal of Algerian history from a woman's perspective.

title: Serbia: At least eight killed and a dozen injured in shooting south of Belgrade
description: The shooting occurs just days after a 13-year-old boy shot dead eight of his classmates and his school guard in Belgrade using a semi-automatic weapon.
